name: Standing Leg Curl
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your back against a wall, holding the standing leg curl machine with one handle in each hand. Hold your chest out and engage your core.
2. Place your heels on the foot platform of the machine, with the edge of the platform positioned just behind your heels.
3. Slowly lower your legs straight down towards the ground by flexing your knees. Keep your back flat against the wall throughout this movement.
4. Lower until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings and glutes. Avoid letting your back arch or your core sag during this process.
5. Push through with your heels, extending your legs fully to return to the starting position. Ensure control during the entire movement.
6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Standing leg curl is an isolation exercise that targets the hamstrings and glutes.
